question: Could Elizabeth I of England have seen Romeo and Juliet? (1) yes (2) no
answer: Queen Elizabeth I ruled of England and Ireland from 17 November 1558 until 24 March 1603. She died in 1603. Romeo and Juliet, play by William Shakespeare, written about 1594-96 and first published in an unauthorized quarto in 1597. Since 1597 is before 1603, the queen has seen Romeo and Juliet. So the answer is: (1) yes.

question: Would Jane Goodall be considered an expert in oceanography? (1) yes (2) no
answer: Jane Goodall is considered the world's foremost expert on chimpanzees. She has on work in oceanography. Thus, she would not be considered an expert in oceanography. So the answer is: (2) no.

question: Did Edward of Westminster ever spend time in Gloucestershire? (1) yes (2) no
answer: Edward of Westminster was killed aged seventeen at the Battle of Tewkesbury. Besides, Tewkesbury is located in Gloucestershire, England. Therefore, Edward of Westminster spent time in Gloucestershire. So the answer is: (1) yes.

question: Does human with no gear die capturing giant squid in natural habitat? (1) yes (2) no
answer: The giant squid live deep underwater. If human goes to their habitat to capture, they need to go to the deep water. Humans need equipment to maintain life in the deep sea. Hence, human with no gear will die when capturing giant squid in natural habitat. So the answer is: (1) yes.

question: Would a bartender make a cocktail for Noah Schnapp? (1) yes (2) no
answer: Noah Cameron Schnapp is an American actorperson who was born in 2004. He was not of the minimum legal age to purchase alcoholic beverages. As the cocktail is kind of alcoholic beverages, it is illegal for a bartender make a cocktail for Noah Schnapp. So the answer is: (2) no.
